message.content:
cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.CL

The paper describes a method to build a semantic network from scientific literature and uses it to predict future trends in research. This involves the use of neural networks and natural language processing techniques, which are commonly used in the fields of machine learning (cs.LG), information retrieval (cs.IR), and computational linguistics (cs.CL). Additionally, the paper focuses on a specific discipline, quantum physics, which is a subfield of physics and could be categorized under cs.SI (Scientific Computing) or cs.DL (Digital Libraries) due to the large corpus of scientific papers used in the study.
